title: Brazil at the 1960 Summer Olympics
text:
<a href="Fourth%20Brazilian%20Republic">Brazil</a> competed at the <a href="1960%20Summer%20Olympics">1960 Summer Olympics</a> in <a href="Rome">Rome</a>, <a href="Italy">Italy</a>. 72 competitors, 71 men and 1 woman, took part in 35 events in 14 sports. Brazilians obtained two bronze medals in Rome. The swimmer <a href="Manuel%20dos%20Santos%20%28swimmer%29">Manuel dos Santos</a> was a bronze medalist in <a href="Swimming%20at%20the%201960%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20100%20metre%20freestyle">men's 100 metre freestyle</a>. The <a href="Brazil%20national%20basketball%20team">men's basketball team</a> also won the bronze medal. Flagbearer and defending two-time Olympic champion <a href="Adhemar%20Ferreira%20da%20Silva">Adhemar Ferreira da Silva</a> could not repeat his performance and placed fourteenth in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%201960%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20triple%20jump">triple jump</a>,
Cycling.
One male cyclist represented Brazil in 1960.
Modern pentathlon.
Three male pentathletes represented Brazil in 1960.
Rowing.
Brazil had five male rowers participate in one out of seven <a href="rowing%20%28sport%29">rowing</a> events in 1960.
Shooting.
Three shooters represented Brazil in 1960.
